div.l: AT trompynton nat fer from cambrige
There goth a broke and ouir that a bryge
Vpon the whiche broke ther stonte a mylle
And this is verry soth that I you telle
A myller was there duelling many a day
As any pecoke he was proude and gay
Pype he coude and fysshe and nettys bete
And turne cuppes and wele wrastyl and shete
And by his belt he bare along pauad
And of a swerd fulle trenchant was the blade
A ioly popper bare he in his pouche
There was no man for perylle durst him touche
A sheffeld thwetyl bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and camosed was his nose
Also pylled as an ape was his sculle
